intro: Codonoboea falcata, commonly known as the sickleleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive wavy margin, and its stems are often trailing or climbing. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
